page.title: 15FARMING
page.content: One farmer has tried growing crops {organically.}A 20 acre field, which had been unimproved pasture, and therefore had no residual chemicals in the soil, was ploughed and carried a wheat crop in 1985. No chemical sprays or fertilizers were used on it. The quality of the crop was greatly impaired by the weather in August and September, but it showed sufficient promise for the farmer to use the same land for oats in 1986. Because chemical weed killers cannot be used, the land must be cultivated in the spring to destroy weed seedlings, so the oats will be spring, not autumn sown. The crop will be sold for use as muesli.
